intro: Pleurothallis horichii, commonly known as the Horichii orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. This epiphytic plant typically grows on trees or rocks, utilizing its aerial roots to absorb moisture and nutrients from the environment. It produces small, delicate flowers that are usually greenish-white or pale yellow, with a subtle fragrance. The plant is noted for its compact size and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and ease of care. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
